Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful and good rooms”
Reviews.Author: d_amavad
Reviews.Content: A 3 night stay at this hotel close to taksim square has been comfortable and convenient. The staff I have encountered, but particularly Meltem on reception have been friendly and inviting. I recently stayed at another hotel called City Center in Istanbul which was truly awful but this hotel is a world away. It's quiet even though it is close to Taksim Square and the crowd-swelling Istikal Street. The rooms have comfortable beds, good air-conditioning and enough storage space.

Reviews.Title: “I was happy there”
Reviews.Author: Arezou Z
Reviews.Content: I suggest this hotel to every one who is care about staying in a modern and clean place whit an average price.

Reviews.Title: “More a 5* than 4* (with some exceptions)”
Reviews.Author: MrAnyparktos
Reviews.Content: General Locattion: Perfect, only 1 min walk from Taksim (and Taksim metro stop), but away from the hustle & bustle of Istiklal street (it is on the other side of Taksim) Breakfast: more than adequate-very large selection of things and very tasty! (some you don't even find in a 5* hotel, like honey comb!) Minus: no fresh orange juice and no other selection of coffee than filter Room Space: Adequate size (not too big, but in no case small) Cleanliness: Evereything was shining! Sheets changed every day Bed: extremely confortable with 4 pillows for double (there is a pillow menu) Furniture: everything's new, not even a scratch or a dirty part on the wall! Very modern! Amentities-services: Soap, shampoo, conditioner, body cream, sweing kit, cotton buds-all of good quality (because in some hotels you can tell they are of the cheapest choice), slippers, safe, free wi-fi (very strong signal and fast speed), large selection of tv channels (even a greek one!), free coffee, tea facilities and a small bottle of water renewed every day Minus: no bathrobe Minibar: full of choices (even condoms!), almost reasonably priced for such a hotel (e.g. Beverages: 8TL) The one and only bad experience was the restaurant! The staff does not speak English (they just know some words) so it is very difficult to communicate your order! I have ordered 2 hours earlier so that my food would be at my room when I came back! They did not understand and they delivered when I was away. When I came back I was waiting and called them to see what happened. They told me it was going to be at my room in 10 min. It took 40 min. and some complaints to the reception to bring a broken glass and the wrong dessert!! Unacceptable service for this hotel! At least, in the end they told me it was complimentary..

Reviews.Title: “perfect and quiet location in the middle of Taxim”
Reviews.Author: atomtom
Reviews.Content: clean and very quiet mid size hotel in 1 minute walking distance to Taxim square. Close to Taxim 2 mls of shopping zone with all major label shops plus turkish delights. There are good restaurants in the area, but the nicer and cheaper ones are arround Taxim square and left and right of the shopping mile.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - very clean, modern, and central”
Reviews.Author: Yudworld
Reviews.Content: Went to Istanbul during Easter 2012 and chose the hotel because of its location and the reviews on trip advisor. We were extremely satisfied with the overall hotel experience. The details are: - Location - Taksim is an excellent location, close to all public transportation in Istanbul and also walking distance to many historical sites so staying in this area really allows you to explore the city by foot and also to use metro/bus/trams (Istanbul has an excellent infrastructure). It also felt less touristy because the locals also come to Taksim to shop, eat and enjoy the night life. - Cleanliness/room: This hotel earns top marks for its cleanliness. There is always that first impression when walking into a room - here the smell was fresh and clean. Once inside of the room, all was modern. For example, I never hang my clothes or uses hotel drawers - this time the room felt so clean that I had no concern. Daily housekeeping service was very good and it showed. The toiletries are good and in the room you also get slippers and a nice selection of magazines in English - TimeOut Istanbul (very good to check out what's happening in the city) and another magazine with good restaurants. - Service: The team at the reception and doorman was excellent - the whole team (Hacer, Emer? and the two gentlemen in the afternoon shifts thank YOU!). Always smiling and helping us with recommendations. They recommended 360 one night and we really like it - good place to go and have a pre-dinner drink or after dinner drink. The hotel recommended tours which we didn't use and this was something I would do differently. There are many long lines when going to see the Topkapi palace or the Blue Mosque and having a guide means you don't have to wait as well as you get the whole history. The prices quoted in the service recommended by the hotel was also more competitive than what you get when you go to the museums and try to get a guide there. Transportation - we used the hotel service to and from the airport. It was included on the way to the hotel and we decided to use it on the way back. The cost was 70 TL - it was convenient and reliable. Having said there is a cheaper service using public transport that I understand goes every 30 minutes and cost around 15 TL per person. The hotel can give the details. Breakfast/Eating at the hotel - we didn't have breakfast included and at 14 EUR for breakfast at the hotel, we decided to explore the local turkish cafes rather than eat at the hotel so can't rate the food. If you chose to eat out for breakfast I can highly recommend the "House Cafe" in Istakl (spelling?) street - around 10 minute walk from the hotel and has excellent breakfast selection. All and all - a wonderful experience in a very good hotel! Would definitely recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest Hotel in Taksim Square”
Reviews.Author: DeeAnn18
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Midtown for 3 days in Feb 2012. Pleasantly surprised to be given a clean room with a comfortable bed. There was a large screen TV, hot water pot with complimentary coffee/tea, mini fridge and safe in the room. The bathroom and shower was squeaky clean - no mildew, and well stocked with bathroom amenities and nice large towels. I had to study for a brief, and there was no noise from the outside. I slept very well, great centralized location near speciality shops and restaurants, and 3 min walk from the Istiklal street - the busy shopping district. I did not dine at the hotel but was given free cay (tea) at the hotel bar which also serves cafe latte. Staff was very courteous and spoke English. Recommends this hotel for adults.

Reviews.Title: “Saleh al-amri”
Reviews.Author: Saleh A
Reviews.Content: The staff very frindely and the place stay, service and clean very excellent There is one he is very good he is name fathi he is excellent one if u need any information just ask my friend fathi Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: akshaysobti
Reviews.Content: Went to Istanbul for New year eve 2011. Stayed in Midtown hotel for 5 nights. The location is superb. Really in the heart of the city centre and everything is around us, from Clubs,bars to shopping street and plenty of restaurants. Pleasant hotel and friendly staff. WOuld certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ozan81
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter the lobby you know that this hotel has an extraordinary atmosphere. We stayed elsewhere several times and were never completely satisfied. But this time we felt different. The design of the lobby is very modern and rich. The staff is very friendly. In a 4* hotel you may not expect such a friendly staff but Midtown looks like a 5* hotel with their staff even including porter. I had booked a standard room in 8th floor. When i entered the room, i was delighted with the spacious, clean and well decorated room. the mirrors on the walls give a spacious atmosphere.The room welcomes you with free tea&coffee. You have a menu for pillows. you may request any pillow from the reception and they will bring in minutes. may be these are very small details but it is very satisfactory when they took care of these. The breakfast was absolutely spectacular.I haven't seen such a rich breakfast in similar hotels. The reason is very simple. They have an award winner chief in their kitchen staff. The successful team has been awarded by gold, silver and bronze medals and certificates in 2009, 2010 and 2011. The location of the hotel is at the heart of Istanbul. You can reach everywhere from Taksim. We will definitely go back to stay at Midtown Hotel next time we are in Istanbul. Thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: HamzaTripoli
Reviews.Content: It's was a short stay for long weekend 3 days but it was one of my best weekend in Taksim in Istanbul. The hotel is very clean and new just near to Taksim square the must busy area in Istanbul. The staff of the hotel is very good . I've enjoyed my stay at this hotel and I'm sure I'll be back again. Thanks to all Midtown hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in good location”
Reviews.Author: Jandenz
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff especially in reception with Melten and Can. Definitely highly recommended hotel for excellent service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cfgard
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business and it was excellent, good location near the metro, restaurants and bars. During bad weather the reception were very helpful in assisting me with transport across to the Asian side. Rooms were lovely and clean with free wi-fi. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: tman12
Reviews.Content: Here is the good.... 1. I was upgraded to a corner suite without asking. The room is large, clean and modern. It had a jacuzzi tub/shower combination with great toiletries, including massage/exfoliation oil 2. Free wifi internet. You will need to get a password from the front desk and it may change during your stay 3. Tea maker with complimentary tea and coffee. bottled water also 4. Easy to use safe that could store a 15" laptop 5. Breakfast buffet is good, not spectacular, but you are not paying for spectacular 6. Comfortable beds 7. Pretty quiet location for being so close to Taksim Sq. The street is blocked off and has security on who can drive into the area 8. You can see the airport bus from the hotel, so convenient to take bus for 10TL vs a taxi for 45TL 9. Staff is friendly and helpful 10. Use of the Titanic City hotel spa and gym for free, (2 blocks away). Gym has 2 treadmills, elliptical and recombinant bike. surprisingly it has free weights with bench and incline bench, light dumbells (10 kg heaviest weight) 11. Near Subway system which is easy to use (2TL each way) 12. Plenty of options for restaurants. You can get a decent meal for less than 20TL 13. Starbucks close by...Grande Latte is 6.50TL 14. Right around the corner is Said Baklava (Sehit Muhtar Cad. No 12). This is great baklava that you have to try. Not Cheap, it is sold by weight... 36TL per kilo, which is alot. You can get 6-7 pieces for about 8TL Here is the bad... 1. There is no bad for the price. It is a great value well worth more in other cities

Reviews.Title: “Good for business trip”
Reviews.Author: nathkingcole
Reviews.Content: Well located. Close to metro and tram. Many restaurants, cafeterias and shops nearby. Taksim is very busy and alive at night as well. Bus stop from/to the airport 3mn away from the hotel. Free wifi in the rooms and free access to super spa/and fitness center of a bigger hotel nearby. Great value

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Peter E
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, the Hotel is located just 5 min from Taksim Square. The staff is friendly but they could do with a course of English speaking. If you travel from Sabiha GÃ¶kÃ§en Airport, be aware of the long bus/taxi trip to and from the Hotel. (1 to 1 1/2 hours). The Hotel offers a "special service", it will cost you 250 Lira (100 euro) one way! If you take a taxi the price will be between 80 and 120 Lira depending on the traffic. If you take the bus it will cost you only 12 Lira! (the busstop is about 5 minutes from the Hotel) If you take a taxi to go somewhere, fix a price beforehand otherwise it could become very expensive due the enormous trafficjams.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Darsont
Reviews.Content: Thank you all the hotel staff for the wonderful stay in their place. I would like to specially mention Melthem who worked hard to make our stay pleasent and enjoyable. Thank you Melthem and thank all the staff for us, including the boy from Kars ( just forgot his name), but all of you were helpful and friendly. Congratulations to the everyone and a Very Merry Christmas from Brasilia - Brasil

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Eglib
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Midtown Hotel Taksim for four nights. It is at the center of the city, next to Metro Station and Beyoglu. In half an hour we reached the old town , TopkapÄ± Palace, Blue Mosque, area by metro. It was clean and quiet, the reception desk personnel were all kind and helpful. Open buffet breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in busy istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mm70
Reviews.Content: Brilliant located.Silent modern Rooms. Good breakfast. Helpful careing lovely stuff. I had to stay one night before moving to a private apartment and was overwhelmed by this spot. Thank you midtown hotel letting me have a fantastic experience ! Would I recommend the place! 100 percent - it s a jewel in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, good location, nice and clean, good staff, excellent Wifi connection.”
Reviews.Author: Martin P
Reviews.Content: But expensive breakfast. We never tried it so maybe it was worth â‚¬15. Instead we walked 200 m to Taksim Square and a bakery where we got sandwiches and coffe for six people for the price of one Hotel breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: BCGlenda
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend Midtown Hotel- great location off of Taksim Square (very easy to find from Havas Shuttle drop off from airport) & fun to stroll along Istiklal to check out restaurants & shopping. Check-in was seamless & friendly- they even gave us toothbrushes when they heard that the airline had misplaced our luggage & we had no toiletries. Free Wi-Fi is available & the rooms are modern with good size, clean bathrooms. Our room did NOT smell like smoke which was refreshing in a city where there are a lot of smokers. The beds are comfortable & the rooms are very quiet (did not hear any street noise). Early discount when reserving on-line makes this hotel a great bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Service, Value, and Cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Ourexperience60
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Midtown surpassed the international 5 star hotel chain on all the key variables associated with service, value and cleanliness. I highly recommend the Midtown. I recently completed a 13 day trip in Istanbul. Splitting my time between a nearby large 5 star international conference hotel and the Midtown. The friendly service at check-in followed me throughout my stay including packing a sandwich and soft drink for my very early departure at check-out 5 days later. My room was spotless, modern and very quiet with a room safe that was big enough to accept my lap top. The hotel is in a quiet 'traffic restricted' zone on the edge of very busy and loud Taksim Square. An oasis of calm. Breakfast buffet was very good although not as extensive as some higher priced competitors. We ate dinner at the hotel in their lobby twice as the food was excellent! Their local Kebab platter was superb. Wait service was attentive and appropriately friendly. Their recommendations for local restaurants were also appreciated. No on site workout facility but they offer free access to a nearby hotel fitness center that was a block away. It was clean and well maintained although the cardio equipment was limited.

Reviews.Title: “Excellens in service”
Reviews.Author: JoelUppsala12
Reviews.Content: My stay at Midtown was a wonderful experience. A calm oasis in a city with extreme puls. As I left i forgot a part of my computer at the room and the hotel sent it to Sweden. Thats good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Hakan H
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Midtown Hotel and the services were excellent from first until last encounter during my stay. I choose to return to Midtown Hotel again as my first stay was super nice. The hotel has it all, great location; great staff and the rooms are nicely decorated in a contemporary style. The staff was all friendly, efficient and helpful when ever you needed their help with something. Thanks to you all. Located only a step away from the bus stop for the airport shuttle and the Taksim Square makes it an excellent choice as you have all the activity just at the door step but still quite as the hotel is located on a pedestrian street so you will not be disturbed from any traffic noise. Will for sure return to Midtown Hotel during my next stay this year in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, services, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: rezarav1974
Reviews.Content: We have already checked out from midtown hotel and I dont want to wait even an minute to write my idea. It is a great hotel with a friedly staff and very good location in heart of taksim, the best place in istanbul, much better than soltanahmed area which is very crowded and old. Midtown has offered a very nice breakfast, our room in 10 floor had a great view also. If i want to say something bad about this hotel I can just point to the small blanckets which is not realy important comparison to other services we got.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone was helpful”
Reviews.Author: Alshurooqi
Reviews.Content: The service was awesome. This is my second time staying in this hotel, definitely gona stay in it next year. Good location, good location, good service wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, definitely suggested”
Reviews.Author: Alexandros R
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay in MidTown Hotel. It's in the safe area (with security and guardmen) in Taxim Square. I liked the view (that was really amazing) to the sea and the surrounding blocks. Clean, tidy, friendly people. all you need for vacations. I'm still full from the breakfast :-)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Evan76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Midtown hotel for 5 nights on August 2011. Overall it was a very good experience. The hotel is situated right by Taksim square, in a pedestrian enclave where there are many hotels. Taksim square is crazy busy and noisy 24/7, but Midtown hotel was very very quiet despite being so close to it. So you get the best of both worlds. There are many options around for food, drinks, and snacks. I highly recommend the 'simit saray' chain which has 2 stores on Taksim square, right by Midtown hotel. You can get wonderful Turkish snacks there, such as boureks, sweets and the amazing simit loaf. Also you can get the original kahraman maras dondurma, which is the absolutely BEST ice cream in the world :-) The hotel has nice modern decoration, it was very clean and it offered the amenities expected from a 4 star hotel. The AC is individually controlled and it is very powerful! This is very important in Istanbul, if you re coming during the summer. TV has many satellite channels covering several languages. Hotel staff was helpful and polite, but some of them did nt speak English well. However as we found out this is a general issue in Istanbul, so it can be useful if you can understand and say a few basic phrases in Turkish. The only we did nt quite like at Midtown hotel, was breakfast. We paid 15 euros per person, per day for breakfast and it was definitely not worth it. It has the usual variety of breakfast items, you can find in any 4 star hotel, but we were expecting to find more Turkish breakfast stuff like for example simit, pide breads, kaimak creams etc. The worst thing however was the coffee. You can only have filter coffee from a big machine, which is boiling hot, very weak and pretty awful... If you want a cappuccino, an espresso or a Turkish coffee you have to pay extra. In my opinion this is unacceptable and we have never encountered it in our numerous stays in 4 star hotels elsewhere. To sum up, breakfast is basic and average ( except the horrible coffee ) but its definitely not worth 15 euros. So if you can avoid it, do it. You can get a much better deal in the nearby 'simit saray' store. Overall, if you choose to stay at Taksim area, Midtown hotel is an excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect stay! The hotel is”
Reviews.Author: MariliaCosta
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay within a walking distance to Taksim Square, to many attractions and to the subway station. The staff were very helpful , really friendly and courteous. They advised us on where to go and how to get there. They made everything possible to make our stay a really confortable one. If we ever go back to Istanbul, we will sure stay at this hotel and we recommend this place to anyone reading this review.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in centre of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Paaltjes
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. The location is excellent, just a few steps from Taksim Square, but because the hotel is in a pedestrian only street, there is totally no traffic noise. Many shops and restaurants are only a stone throw away. Staff at the hotel are professional and friendly. Rooms are standard but very clean and with good beds. Breakfast buffet was good and reasonable priced. We did not use bar and restaurant for other meals as there was too much choice in the neighbourhood. If you want character this hotel is not for you, but if you look for reliable and comfortable accommondation for a reasonable price I surely will recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: fayrouz
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff treated me in a very bad way based on discremenatory issues. They refused to allow a friend to check in with me although i paid double room and they humiliated me and used impolite expressions because of my sexual orientation. Be careful they can be very bad. they are a scar on the face of the beautiful city

Reviews.Title: “recommendation”
Reviews.Author: istanbul1972
Reviews.Content: midtown hotel is perfect especially the helpful staff in reception Miss.Meltem was very helpful and co operative very friendly with cystomers , i appreciate her help and hotel location are very good also near taxim and all atraction within walking or easy access you can reach , i recommend this hotel and will give them 9 from 10

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but hit and miss service”
Reviews.Author: LawWM
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip in July 2011. While the hotel was well located for my meetings, if I was in Istanbul for a holiday I would stay closer to the Galata tower area. In general I thought the hotel was ok and one receptionist was very helpful and friendly. However, other staff were quite rude at times. The worst example of this was when I had a colleague with me planning our presentation for the next day and I received a very rude phone call to my room stating that guests were not allowed and that we must work in the lobby area. I found this very unprofessional and embarrassing. I would not stay here again because of this treatment - it is most unusual and the member of staff was very impolite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-extremely clean-very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Georgeemadarmanious
Reviews.Content: George Armanious the hotel is perfectly located in taksim square. You probably wouldn't find a better location in this area. The hotel is extremely clean and pleasent. Comfortable rooms clean bathrooms. The hotel is may b new or recently rennovated so u feel you feel u are the first person to stay in the room. The only disadvantage about this hotel is that some of the staff are unfriendly just some of them. Some are very helpful and friendly. I would definitely choose this hotel again if I visit Istanbul once more

Reviews.Title: “I feel 2nd home !!!”
Reviews.Author: Huseyin C
Reviews.Content: When i checked in and the front desk staff was very pleasant and knowledgeable, the hotel was highly maintained and very clean. Breakfast was excellent, dinner was very delicious and 5 stars quality. The room had up to date features like flat screen TV complimentary coffee and tea station and comfortable bed. All staff was very friendly and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean hotel on a wonderful street that doesn't allow cars”
Reviews.Author: Theone40
Reviews.Content: Visiting Istanbul from as far as the USA can be intimidating but Midtown Hotel made it seem like I was visiting a good friend who wanted to take care of me and make sure I was enjoying myself. Midtown helped find me an excellent tour guide and answered all my questions with patience and a smile. The rooms were clean, contemporary and the layout was functional. The bathrooms were very pretty as well. The food was delicious and I enjoyed the location. A quaint quiet street filled with locals. Lots of attractive restaurants and street cafes with the bonus of no traffic...instead cobblestones, shady trees and flowers. One has lots of options getting around town. My guide showed me how to take the subway, community taxi, above ground tram and of course there is always a taxi. Oh, I forgot to mention that the breakfast is fantastic. HOPE TO RETURN SOON!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for tourism in Istanbul, almost a Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrazilAca
Reviews.Content: Midtown is a very nice hotel for tourism. Well located, just a block from Taksim Square and Istiklal Street in Istanbul and at walking distance or short cab drive (10 to 25 min) to all main attractions. At Taksim Square you can also find the Metro station. Itâ€™s a modern hotel, fairly nice staff and a good restaurant, even though there are other good options at walking distance for lunch and/or dinner. However, be prepared, the rooms are small and tight, very European style! Overall a good indication for tourism in beautiful Istanbul, almost a Boutique Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but impolite staff”
Reviews.Author: testerix
Reviews.Content: To start with: The hotel was fine for me until a friend came to visit me. The security told me very rude that they do not allow guests at the room. It was early evening and we did not plan to party at the room. I was more than surprised and asked what he believes we will do â€“ he just referred to the policy of the house, which is not published anywhere. For this reason I did not felt welcome their and cannot recommend to anyone â€“ just imagine which strange â€œpoliciesâ€� they will invent next time...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and very convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Lori_Antony
Reviews.Content: Midtown hotel is very nice, clean, with spacious rooms. Very convenient location, close to all main spots in Istanbul, and yet very quiet at night. Rich breakfast, and reception staff very helpfull. We would definetely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel with excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: rhyd78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Midtown for four nights in March 2011. Here are my main impressions of the hotel: - a modern business hotel but very amenable to your everyday holiday-maker - I had a relatively small room with a tiny window but it was modern, comfortable and clean with a good-sized bathroom and fantastic shower. There was also the usual complimentary bottle of water, some Turkish sweets and a relatively cheap mini-bar plus free wireless connection. - the staff at reception were extremely helpful and were more than happy to assist with directions etc. - the hotel is located in the Taksiim Square area of the city which is modern and as close to European as you'll get in Istanbul. Only a minute or so's walk to the square itself (really nothing to see there) and around 5 minutes from the main (huge) shopping street, Istiklal Caddesi, and the accompanying bars/restaurants. There are also a few decent places to eat and drink right next to the hotel but also a few dodgy places so be sensible, especially at night. - the hotel is a fair old drive from the old town / Sultanahmet, where you'll find the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofia so if you're interest lies predominantly in that part of town you'd be better off getting a hotel there as it's a pain to travel, especially in rush hour. - I didn't eat at the hotel (too many other good / cheaper places nearby, so can't comment on the standard of food. - the cost was very reasonable (at under Â£350 for four nights) All in all, it's not a 5* (some may even find it a little soulless) but I would definitely recommend staying here for the cost, the convenience and the basic comfort the hotel provided.

Reviews.Title: “Good Find - Brilliant Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Shaheenp
Reviews.Content: We had an 8 night stay in Istanbul in which we move old city to Taksim. Midtown was a good move with its modern comforts, ambience, good service and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: PMLC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Midtown Hotel for 2 nights on december 2010. We liked very much! The location is amazing: just a few minutes from Taksim Square, Istiklal Cadesi (our prefered place), restaurants, metro! The hotel is charmming, clean and the staff is very kind. The room and the bath is a little small, but ok! We recommend even for those who also visit Sultanahmet, because is not so far!

Reviews.Title: “Average capital city hotel, service not slick, but pleasant staff.”
Reviews.Author: noplacelikehomegirl
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are extremely helpful and accomodating - which is just as well as you need to keep asking them for things. So, everything is great when you arrive, but then after the first visit from housekeeping the drinking mugs are not replaced, nor is the single 'complimentary' bottle of water ever there after the first one on arrival, nor are the coffee or tea replenished. Small tiny things, but just iritating when the last thing you want to be doing is repeatedly calling reception. And one call does not remedy the situation. These things are never put right. The hotel is pleasant enough - clean and modern, Small typical capital city rooms, Nothing special at all. We visited in late December and found that the heating in the room is sweltering and cannot be reduced effectively, It can be turned OFF in total and the window opened. But this is the only solution and it is unbearably hot!! . We heard other guests also mentioning this problem to the (did I mention, lovely) staff on reception. Breakfast is served in a enjoyable restaurant space and there is plenty of choice. Fabulous location and although not cheap, we found it to be the best deal really for a hotel of this rating in this great Central Taksim location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service and location”
Reviews.Author: NottsUKLyn
Reviews.Content: The staff here ticked all the boxes of 1st class customer service.This hotel is in a prime location down a pedestrianised quaint street but within easy reach of Taksim Square, shops/restaurants/nightlife etc. The rooms are clean and comfortable worthy of the 4 star rating. The only thing this hotel lacks is a high view of the Bosphorus and skyline which we saw from a few of the prestigous hotel chains having said that not worth the ridiculously higher cost in comparison to the Midtown and able to see this from restaurants and other landmarks during our stay. Would definately consider returning. A must is the evening Bosphorous Dinner Cruise Tour.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: saraharbab
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a good feel when you entered, a nice lobby and friendly staff. The rooms were average sized, very nice and clean. Bathrooms had all amenities which were replaced daily. The location was superb, you could stroll the alleys at night and it had nice bars and bistros with live music all around. The only turn off was the breakfast, but that I didn't find even close to average in all the 3 hotels I stayed during my trip to other parts of Turkey as well.

Reviews.Title: “An Affordable, Comfortable 4-star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sucheslife
Reviews.Content: I found the Midtown to be a strong 4-star hotel and an excellent value in the European section of Istanbul. The Midtown is located in the Takim district of Istanbul about 2.5 miles from the major tourist attractions in the Old Town. Public transportation is convenient to the hotel with a subway station 200 yards from the hotel. I understand you can reach the Midtown from the airport via public transportation; however, I did not try it. The hotel will provide a car for travel to the international airport for 40 euro and during my stay the Midtown. Security is obvious in the tourist sections of Istanbul. The Midtown is located in an enclave complete with security guards who restrict vehicle traffic. This offers the added advantage of minimizing vehicle noise around the hotel. The Midtown also has 24-hour security guards 9as do most of the hotels in the area). If that level of security is not to your Hilton takes security one level higher with complete vehicle searches and every entrance to the property covered by guards. The rooms at the Midtown are small by US standards and similar in size to what you find in other European cities. Although the rooms have 2 chairs they are not really large enough for 2. I would suggest an upgrade to a suite for parties of 2 or more. The only noise I encountered was from the restaurants on the streets below. I would recommend a room on the upper floors for that reason The bed was new and pretty hard with lots of pillows. The furniture was a bit worn but still very functional. The bathroom was modern with a very nice shower fixture in the tub. Air conditioning is important in Istanbul particularly in the summer months. The system in the Midtown is modern and worked very well during my stay. The Midtown provides free wifi enabled internet access. Although other reviewers have covered the free buffet, I still found the quality a surprise. There is something for everyone. The fresh fruit was a real treat. The fresh breads were very popular. The buffet includes both scrambled and hard-boiled eggs. In addition, the chef provides a variety of meats and cooked vegetables that provided menu variety from day-to-day. I had dinner in the restaurant on 3 occasions and found the food quality excellent. In addition, there are a broad variety of restaurants within easy walking distance that serve until late at night. Ramadan was being celebrated during my stay and the restaurant was hosting several large groups The staff at the hotel was friendly and professional. Most speak English and all are eager to please. Room pricing seems to vary widely depending on demand. If you book early and catch them when there is not a major sporting or cultural event in the area you will get a high-quality room at a generally quiet, safe hotel. I was completely satisfied with this hotel and the Midtown will be my first choice next time I go to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great find, perfect location, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: jasondarling
Reviews.Content: Perfect location right off Taksim square. Very central and close to the "downtown" stuff like nightlife, food, shopping. A 10-15 taxi ride to Hagia Sophia and all the Sultanahmet sites but that was probably a good thing since that's such a tourist trap. Not that Taksim isnt it's own tourist trap, but at least that is tempered by huge quantities of local folks. Rooms definitely 4 star and comfortable with nice bathrooms, beds, etc. Friend and I shared a twin room. Decent size, not too cramped with two people and their stuff. TV was small and had only one non-turkish station which was shared between german, english, french and italian tv feeds during the day. Not sure why this was but it was only a drawback when i got a stomach bug and was laid up for a day. Something else to consider--unlike big 5 star hotels which usually filter their own water, this hotel apparently doesnt. Avoid the water!! Hotel laundry service reliable and did good work. Staff downstairs was fast and efficient, even if their english wasnt super amazing. I'd stay here again. Comparable to boutique version of a westin but with free (turkish, not western) breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “The best reviews so far from my customers who have been visiting Istanbul in 2009 .”
Reviews.Author: Zeryanyc
Reviews.Content: I do own a restaurant in new York and obviously most of my chats with my clients is about turkey , where did you stay ? What did u do etc. Anyway a few people that had stayed in this new hotel couldn't finish with nice words. I want to thank this hotel for making people happy ! Showing them Turkish hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Mid-Level Midtown”
Reviews.Author: prashant246
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for about a week. Loved the location @ Taksim .....The metro, tram bus stations were all a 2 minute walk. The rooms were very very tiny and had felt very stuffed. The free locker was a good touch. During our stay the cupboards fancy glass mirror shutters came off :)...... really.The bath was not too bad. The AC was moody and despite our complaints they could not get it to cool our tiny room properly. The luggage transfer to/from lobby took quite a while. The breakfast was decent ... boiled eggs only, omlette and half fried was charger extra ): meat, cheese, fruits and cornflakes came standard. The icing on the cake was us being accused of burning a bed sheet and being charged 40 lira for it. After arguing it out thrice they finally backed down and let us go. No apoligies were offered and thereon the reception staff was a icy at best. The hotel is ok if ur a business traveller or are travelling in a group. Individuals and couples should avoid this hotel and try the variety of hotels available around Taksim.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: Dpak7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in the first week of July...The hotel has a great locatio, 5 minutes to Taksim and Istiklal street. A very safe area and a lot of friendly cafes and bars near it. The airconditioning worked very well in the room which was great as it was getting very hot outside. The hotel staff was very nice in calling the cabs for us and explaining where we wanted to go. We stayed on the 10th floor and the view was not attractive as we were overlooking houses and hotels. The room is modern and fairly decent in size compared to other cities in Europe. The bathroom is clean and the house-keeping was good. The only downside was that we though the hotel was pushing only certain restaurants and tours, which we were told by our local friends, were extremely touristic and over priced. The best part of the stay was the excellent breakfast with fresh fruits, olives, turkish breads among other great things! The staff was very nice during the breakfast and served with a smile...All in all, the staff is great, the location is excellent and the rooms are good....would surely stay here next time...

Reviews.Title: “Great location ... luggage didn't arrive but hotel delivered anniversary gifts”
Reviews.Author: LVS
Reviews.Content: Location is right near Taksim Square but on a pedestrian only street so it's pretty quiet at night. Hotel is modern, rooms have everything we needed, including a daily bottle of water, choice of pillows (you can request what you want). Breakfast was nicest we had in Turkey with something different every day, in addition to the usual fruits, yogurt, breads and pastries, assortment of yummy Turkish cheese, honeycomb w/dripping honey, coffee and juices. It is self-service but staff is available to help if needed. When we arrived without our luggage, we mentioned that the next day was our 40th anniversary. When we returned to our room the next evening, hoping to find our suitcases, they weren't there. BUT -- we had a letter from the hotel manager along with a basket of fruit and a beautiful display of Turkish pastries. Timing could not have been better. We felt so taken care of. Free wi-fi but I had no way to charge my iTouch. When I asked what I might do of the front desk staff, they offered to charge the iTouch on the front desk computer. We went elsewhere in Turkey and were able to store our suitcases (which did eventually arrive) at the hotel so that we could just take a small bag with us. I gave a 4 instead of 5 to rooms only because we could hear outside noises from another room with children. Otherwise, the room was excellent. I highly recommend the hotel, location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located hotel with all modern amenties and good service”
Reviews.Author: meeramumbai
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel with 5 friends - we all were on a Holiday in Istanbul . The Hotel is very well located -surrounded by Street Cafe's , close to Money Changers and Shops and walking distance from Taksim Square and Istiklal Street . The staff of the Hotel were always polite and courteous and helpful - despite their limited knowledge of the english language. The food too was good and the rooms adequately equipped with all modern amenties . Our stay was comfortable and a good experience ont he whole The Hotel is reccommended to one and all .

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CMHCanada
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for 5 nights during our visit to Istanbul. While it is conveniently located near Taksim Square, the street is very quiet with lots of character and no car traffic!! The hotel staff were very helpful and very professional. The room was spacious and very clean. While Istanbul is awash in so much history, staying in a hotel with a modern decor was a welcomed change. I don't think I can say enough good things about the food. The breakfast buffet was incredible and no other hotel during our two week trip came close to the quality and choice provided by the Midtown. We also had dinner at the restaurant one evening and the food and service was fantastic. Thank you Yasin! I would highly recommend this hotel to travellers looking for quality accommodations in the heart of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Stupendous hotel - if you find a good price, book it!”
Reviews.Author: TomBrazil
Reviews.Content: When visiting Istanbul, I was looking for a nice hotel, near Taksim district, and Midpoint was kind of expensive. Then suddenly I've found an Internet offer and booked. What a surprise - the hotel is amazing. First of all - I don't remember EVER having a BETTER BREAKFAST than that. Fruits, olives, mediterranean cuisine mixed with regular breakfast for DIFFERENT MEALS EVERY DAY. I'm sure there's a great chef on those guys cuisine - they must have one. Location is excellent if you're looking for Taksim, the main point is just a few blocks away, there are lot's of cabs, currency exchange and convenience stores one block from the hotel. And taxi is cheap at Istanbul - if you DON'T LET THEM ROB YOU, cause they're gonna try to overcharge you all the time. Eyes on taxi fare and complain to the city hall/ police if you need - they are serious about that with tourists. Anyway, back to the hotel, besides starting the day with a marvellous breakfast, all the rest was good to - excellent room, bathroom, cleanliness - and the best hotel I have stayed so far in Europe. Can be expensive, search throught rates - but you will have nothing to regreat with this hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect intro to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Smoochiep
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Istanbul and we chose to stay in Mid-town hotel for the convenience and after reading reviews on tripadvisor. I was quite impressed with the level of service and the room. Very clean and comfortable. I was even more impressed with the quality and range of breakfast. I have stayed in many hotels and this was the only hotel which served more than 20 varieties of food for breakfast. Everything tasted DELICIOUS! I felt sorry for the people sitting next to our table having a piece of plain toast and coffee- how could people be so unadventurous?! There was everything from cheeses to olives to breads to cakes to pastries to conserves to relishes to cold cut meats.... thinking about it is making me drool! Besides the incredible food, the staff were quite helpful and assisting. When we checked out they kindly arranged a taxi for us to take us to our next destination. Taksim was a hop, skip and jump away. Great location!.

Reviews.Title: “the best service so you feel as you are in your home”
Reviews.Author: midt0wn
Reviews.Content: i will recommend all my freinds to make residence in midtown hotel

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: ParisAmerTrvlr
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on location, friends' recommendations and TripAdvisor recommendation. I was still pleasantly surprised with clean, modern rooms, spacious bathroom, soundproof room, good breakfast and especially helpful staff; many speak good English, Fatih was especially friendly and helpful. Location is steps from Taksim Square (metro, buses, taxis and more) and lots of neighborhood restaurants shops and conveniences. This is a great hotel at a very good price (100 euro/double) given its many amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great everything”
Reviews.Author: quest42good
Reviews.Content: I stayed at MidTown hotel for four nights in mid-January 2010, during a business trip. While my company suggested a selection of business hotels in Taksim area, like Nippon and Metropark, I decided to book this one based on the very positive reviews here on TripAdvisor. I'm glad to say Midtown hotel never gave me chance to regret my decision, and I feel like a smart traveller! Now, a detailed review. Price I booked through the website of the hotel at the Internet rate of EUR 68 per night, breakfast inclusive. Considering the offers of other hotels located in Taksim, which is considered the downtown and the bst place to stay for a business traveller, I think it's a great price for the value provided. Location I did read that the hotel is quite near the Havas shuttle bus that connects Taksim and Ataturk airport, however I didn't not really imagine that it's THAT close. Arriving at around 7pm I had absolutely no difficulty finding the hotel - just cross the street and it's there, just around the corner. By the way, I was very happy with my decision to take the shuttle bus from the airport, rather than a taxi - the bus stop is just outside the airport exit, you can immediately see the large modern buses with "HAVAS" written on the sides; the bus runs every 30mins, and the trip takes just about 35 mins. The bus is very comfortable, and the ride costs just 10 Turkish Liras (about EUR 2), i.e. about 2.5 times cheaper than a taxi would. Besides, as a solo female traveler I felt safe surrounded by people - mostly locals returning from trips. Not to be seen as biased, however, I must immediately note that I used taxis in Istanbul on a number of other occassions, and it felt quite safe. Another note: having been warned here on the forums about not agreeing the price of the ride with the taxi driver beforehand and insisting upon him using the counter, I must admit I did quite the opposite :). Once, the driver did have the change, but when I left the taxi I found out that he gave me 2 liras instead of five, so you may want to check the change before getting off. Other times it was just fine, but bear in mind that most taxi drivers do not speak a word in English, so be prepared, you may need to learn some basic words in Turkish, like "how much" and the numbers - it helps a lot. But where was I. Midtown hotel is located on a quiet but no means boring cobble-stoned street, which somehow reminded me of the pretty narrow streets at Montmartre :) McDonald's and a Pizza Hut are just around the corner, near Havas bus stop. And so are countless small shops selling everything from bottled water to staples, and, of course Turkish food and sweets. Taksim square is a major hub, so an underground station, bus and tranway stops are all very close to hotel (though I didn't have a chance to use any of them). It's a bustling area, so you feel very safe even at night. However, be sure to remember the way to the hotel, as even taxi drivers seemed to have never heard of neither the hotel, nor Lamartin street. Check-in and Reception Once you are through the revolving door of the hotel, you find yourself in what is a very modern and cosy lobby. The picture of it is actually true. As I was visiting in January, they still did not remove the Christmas tree and the two little reindeers beside it, which was adding to the warm atmosphere of the hotel, in a positive way (see my photos). The receptionist was very friendly and efficient, though there was no one else in the lobby, probably because it was Sunday evening. He gave me a form with just a few things to complete (which is actually good, as you don't have to stand there forever, filling in every tiny detail of yourself), and in a minute I was given my e-key.I requested a room with city view (I think someone recommended doing so in their review posted here), but I found out later that it really makes little sense, as the view is very limited due to buildings surrounding the hotel, so next time I would request a room with street view, which is nice (I could see it from the restaurant). One of the days I asked another receptionist for directions, and she was very helpful, immediately taking out a map and providing orientation. The staff spoke English quite well. Room My room was on the eighth floor, right in front of the elevator. As an experienced traveller may appreciate, this isn't too great, as you can normally hear all the ins and outs of hotel guests, as well as any conversations that go on between them. Let me start with the bad (luckily, it's about the only bad) and say right away that insulation seems to be a problem at the hotel, as not only I could here all the conversations by the elevator, but I was aware of every movement and every noise made by people in the neighboring rooms. A light sleeper can really see an issue here. When checking in I requested a room with city view, which appeared to be a mistake, as all I could see were the walls of the neighboring buildings and satellite antennas. Next time I would request a room with street view, which is actually quite nice â€“ from what I could see out the restaurantâ€™s window. The room itself was quite spacious, with enough furniture in it â€“ a table, a chair, an armchair, and then also a little table, two bedside tables, and of course, the bed â€“ were all available. The bed was very comfortable â€“ perhaps a bit too hard for my personal liking, but very comfortable and, Iâ€™m sure, healthy for oneâ€™s back. I found four pillows on the bed, but they also has a pilow menu listed, which could be requested from the receptionist. The room had a heating system, which worked well (you could turn it on or off, which was far more convenient than a centralized, non-adjustable one). Still, the blanket appeared to be too heavy for me, and I requested a lighter one, which was provided immediately. There were two phones installed in the room and one in the bathroom â€“ a feature I missed in a number of hotels of even higher class. Plumbing and bathroom No doubt, one of their strengths. The bathroom was very spacious, and exceptionally clean. And did I say â€“ CLEAN. Bath with a hugh showerhead and jaccuzzi effects worked seamlessly. They also had this acoustic system installed, which lets you hear whatâ€™s going on in the room while youâ€™re using the bathroom â€“ extremely convenient for listening to the morning news while youâ€™re taking a shower. The hairdryer worked very well, and there was a very convenient magnifying mirror installed. Towels were in plenty. The only thing I missed was a bathrobe, but I didn't ask them to provide one, perhaps that would have worked. Wi-Fi About the only problem I encountered during my stay was that I couldnâ€™t connect to the Internet from my room. It worked well from the reception and the restaurant, but there was no way I could get it work from my room. To be honest, I never complained about that, bearing in mind I would only stay for three days. Had I complained, Iâ€™m sure they would have solved the problem. Food and Drinks There was a kettle, two cups and a selection of tea/coffee/creamer in my room, restored daily, and they provided a complimentary bottle of water every day. Each evening the maid left a chocolate bonbon on my bed, which was nice. Minibar was typically overpriced. Breakfast was good, but nothing special and included a selection of ham/sausages/cheese/bread/sweetbreads, scrambled and boiled eggs, fruits, fruit salad, including fresh strawberries (yummy), muesli, flakes, jam, etcetc. There is also a toaster. All the food were fresh and tasty. Then I first entered the room, there was a selection of sweets provided, with a welcome from the manager. And tasty they were, too! Summary Great cozy yet very modern hotel in an excellent central location. Clean, friendly and comfortable place to stay in a beautiful city. Does have an atmosphere of its own, unlike those faceless chain hotels. Would definitely stay there again, for business or for leisure. Midtown hotel, you'd better continue to be as good as you are, as I have recommended you to a great number of my friends and colleagues already! :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel One Block From Taksim”
Reviews.Author: lostsendhelp
Reviews.Content: The Midtown Hotel is a nice, probably fairly new, hotel in a good location. It was clean, the staff was friendly, there's free WiFi, you can walk anywhere in the Beyoglu area, and there are two metro stops within a block that'll take you anywhere else in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient stopover”
Reviews.Author: blakkkobera
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, conveniently located on a quaint cobbled street close to Taksim Square. Though the hotel is in a busy part of the city, and very central, it is tucked away from the main street in a quiet area. The rooms are clean, and the staff are friendly. We were two groups representing the same company, but were charged different rates for similar rooms on the same day, an error the hotel promised to rectify on our next visit. The area around the hotel and the nearby Taksim square has lots of small shops selling all kinds of Turkish Food (Kofta, Turkish delight and other sweets etc), souvenirs (evil eye bracelets, junk jewellery) and dry fruit. We also caught sight of a few (very!) old people in the pavement outside some shops playing backgammon while they smoked their hookah pipes-a perfect postcard picture! A sensible, reasonable and practical place to stay when visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Midtown Hotel, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AngelikiPap
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, centrally located at Taksim square, worthed every penny. Very clean, personnel was very helpful, great breakfast buffet

Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: OsloBruce
Reviews.Content: Good location, quality food, tasty design, perfect service indeed... Let's make it simple, I am satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish modern hotel in Taksim”
Reviews.Author: GalaMak
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location - only a few minutes of walking from Taksim square and Istiklal street, but the place is very quite and calm. Shuttle bus from the airport stops around the corner so you don't need to take a taxi. Metro station - Taksim square - in 2 minutes walk. Only one stop to Bosphorus ferries and 10 minutes by comformable fast tramway to the old center (Hagia Sofia and Sultanahmet). We had a room with Bosphorus view - it's nice but actually not exactly worth the value cause the view is very limited because of the roofs of the other hotels. If you dream about Bosphorus panorama - better choose some hotel closer. The room is rather small but very nice furnished and very clean - that's really important in Turkey. The photos are completely true - nice chocolate colours are very attractive, and the bathroom is very good and clean. The breakfast is excellent- lot of fresh vegetables, fruits and sweets. We haven't had problems with the personnel but haven't got chance to receive any positive experience also - so I wouldn't comment on it. Reception was polite and professional in spite we arrived late at night. But any discounts because of late check in weren't available also - still it's not a problem. As everywhere in Turkey - be attentive with the currency exchange rates and payment details. But in common the hotel is really good and I would definitely recommend it to my friedns.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a few observations”
Reviews.Author: PeterVarna
Reviews.Content: Like - nice location, rich breakfast, excellent front-desk staff Unlike - housekeeping service - in 7 a.m. making such noise so it was impossible to sleep, we stayed for two nights - no even the waste bin was thrown, not changed towels even put on the bathtub ( in every 4 star hotel it means "please change"), housekeeping just put two cups for tea-coffee facilities even not take away the used. If the hotel management change this it is excellent hotel to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: ZOZODubai_uae
Reviews.Content: I stayed their with my husband and 2 kids for 3 nights, the hotel was great the room was so clean and tidy and the staff was so nice which is something you don't find in other hotels. we stayed in onther hotel for 2 nights and we saw the difference in hospitality and the staff helped us to find places that we enjoyed. If one day I will be back I will sure choose midtown hotel again. also the posion of the hotel is realy good make u near almost everything and away from the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “world class boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: trotterToronto
Reviews.Content: I travel the world and stay at many hotels...specially the finest, but I should say that the Midtown Hotel in Istanbul was home away from home with a little more luxury. Loved everything about this little hotel, from the exceptional staff to its service and of course the tasty food. The best location in all of Istanbul, close to Taksim square and the best luxury beds that hug you at night. Thank you Midtown hotel for adding that little extra touch to a great vacation ever.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: tony5454
Reviews.Content: Ä± m thankfully beÄ±ng stay ur otel so we were very comfortable . everythÄ±ng was so great and your staff were very frÄ±endly. foods so delÄ±cÄ±ous .especially hotel servis dapartman was very professional . thank you very much for your smiling face.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great tÄ±me Ä±n Istanbul and Ä±n MÄ±dtown Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LeiteBraz_l
Reviews.Content: The hotel Ä±s located Ä±n a very good and safe area. However, some taxÄ± drÄ±vers dÄ±dn' know how to get there. The rooms are clear, clean and confortable, as well as the bathroom. The personnel Ä±s really nÄ±ce and frÄ±endly, extremely professÄ±onal and always ready to help and solve guest's problems. I wÄ±ll recommend MÄ±dtown Hotel to my frÄ±ends back Ä±n BrazÄ±l, and next tÄ±me I come to Istanbul, thÄ±s hotel wÄ±ll be my fÄ±rst choÄ±ce.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent choise”
Reviews.Author: elisav
Reviews.Content: I'm consider myself really inspired to choosing these hotel. Good location, clean rooms, kindliness services. Despite inherent and of no interest escapes, the whole staff is nice, complacent and hardworking. I recommend it all.

Reviews.Title: “A pearl in a jungle”
Reviews.Author: PHILIP_CPH
Reviews.Content: It has been the perfect choice for us from the moment we entered the hotel to the time we left. I, my wife and our 3 year old son stayed here 2 nights in our 10 days' long Turkey trip. We noticed that the pictures we had seen before booking in various websites were not tricky at all, and we found the hotel more roomy than the pictures showed. I discovered that the hotel was a "personal project" of the owner who is an architect. It was sort of explanation of many well-planned, designed details. For instance you can notice many horisontal ines in many things: from the furniture to the doors and wall papers - and a very good balance between the squared sharp lines and the soft and more organic lines. I did not notice any detail that was left to the chance. But I believe that all above would not make any differences at all without the right spirit of the hotel personnel we met during our 2-nights'-3-days' stay. The first surprise was that there was prepared and additional bed for my son, free of charge. Well, it could be thought as protecting the good quality mattresses from a toddler's likely wetting issue but this was not the case for our son. On the other hand, the regular double bed we slept in was 200x200 cm that is above standards. Beautiful. I had written our room preferencesabout the room in booking process, (in upper levels, and quiet), and this was taken into consideration. Breakfast was much better than those of some 5 star hotels we knew regarding the quality and its presentation. We regret, however, we did not have the chance of trying the restaurant for lunch or dinner that seemed very promising. The additional info I received was that the chef is also the founder of the Turkish national cooking team for international contests. There were lots of bakery products (of the house) in the nreakfast buffet. 1 of our reasons for choosing this hotel was its convenient location for shuttle busses from and to the airports that is less than 50 meters' walk. In our last day we were going to pick up our luggage around 19.30 hours and it was a rainy ouside. Although it was only 3 pcs. pretty heavy luggage plus the loose and handluggage, and it was only 50 meters (accross the Cumhuriyet caddesi), 1 hotel employee accommpanied us by carrying 2 of our luggage, and another hotel employee lended my wife an umbrella, that would walk with our son. I do not think we would have received same attention and personal care in a 5 star hotel. That is why we thought it has been a perfect choice for us. And for the first time, in my lofe, I happened to feel that I gave to little tip to the people helping us, providing a service more than what they had promised.

Reviews.Title: “Supposedly 4Star hotel. But with 2Star service.”
Reviews.Author: TurkLoves2Travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights from 1st February 2009. Whats Good about this hotel ?: Location is good - thats why I picked this hotel. In Taksim area - where there more that 30 hotels in this area. The rooms/bathroom are good - decent, clean, modern. Good/wide selection of hot/cold items for breakfast. Whats Bad about this hotel ?: Several things! Started right from check in! I had did a booking for 2 pax - however their online reservation system sends a confirmation but for 1 pax instead. I requested for airport pickup(at an additional cost) - that didnt happen. I had a Twin Bed room - however, there is only One wine glass and only one drinking glass. And one mineral bottle for 2 occupants. I was promised by the reservation manager that he will put 2 mineral bottles for us every day. That didnt happen. Bad service - when you go for breakfast dont expected to be greeted or spot a smile on any of the staff. They have a good selection of fruits for breakfast - apples, banana, oranges etc - take as many as you want. However, if you make use the orange juice maker/extractor yourself which is kept in the buffet table or ask the staff to extract juice be prepared to pay 5Lira. When I complained to the F&B manager that it doesnt make sense, I can eat any amount of banana, apple and even orange, however, if I want orange juice I have to pay 5Lira ? If they want to charge 5Lira then dont put the orange juice maker in the buffet area - keep it in the kitchen and take orders and charge if you want to. He agreed with me. And said he will bring up in the morning meeting. I also told him about his staff who are grumpy and dont even greet hotel guests - he said that will change. After the meeting, he comes and tells me there is no charge anymore for freshly squeesed orange juice. Yeah! Well, not so. The next morning, I asked the grumpy staff and was told the orange juice costs 5Lira. I met the GM that morning told him all the problems I had even the orange juice incident - he agreed with me - said that they will not charge for the orange juice from the next day. Yeah right! Next day, I asked the grumpy staff, he looked at me like, "didnt I already tell you it cost 5Lira" ? Well, it still cost 5Lira. I told him his GM said they will not be charging anymore. He apparently was not imformed. Then the F&B manager sees us, 2 minutes later, 2 glasses of complimentary orange juice gets delivered to our table. I didnt drink it at all as I noticed they were still charging OTHER customers despite promises to cease charging. On check out - I was billed for these 2 glasses of orange Juice. Spent 10minutes convincing the staff I didnt order it - and it was give to us complimentary - which I didnt even drink! The General Manager had promised a one litre of mineral water bottle instead when we told him the reservation manager promised 2 mineral bottles for us. That didnt happen. These are just some of the problems. Would I stay here again ? No. I dont need bad service. There are many other good hotels within 1minute walking distance. FYI, as of my last breakfast, they were still charging for the orange juice and the staff were still grumpy without an greeting - you get warmer/better service outside the hotel! - thats the true turkish hospitality Im familiar with!
